description.value:
Totem of Fox

Totem Spirit (Cunning) — Creation Cost: 7 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Trickery / Manipulation / Teaching Through Deception

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Fox, the pack must confront a spirit of clever ambushes, social maneuvering, and layered traps. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Lesson-Weaver Spirit (Fox Aspect) — Suggested base: Spirit-empowered trickster or illusionist (CR 10–12), favoring misdirection and control over raw damage
  • Red-Trail Deceiver Spirit — Suggested base: Fey infiltrator or rogue–caster hybrid (CR 9–11), focused on baiting enemies into poor decisions
  • Snare-Mind Spirit — Suggested base: Aberration- or fey-style planner (CR 8–10) that tests foresight and patience rather than strength

These spirits favor packs that can turn an enemy's aggression against itself.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Persuasion) checks
  • Once per long rest, when you fail a Charisma-based ability check, you may reroll the check and take the new result
  • When you successfully deceive or mislead a creature, you gain advantage on your next Dexterity (Stealth) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check before the end of your next turn

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Fox's cunning.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks
  • Pack members gain advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks
  • Once during the duration, when a hostile creature fails an ability check, saving throw, or attack roll against a pack member, that pack member may immediately move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks

This represents Fox luring enemies into overextension and punishing mistakes.

Ban — Sabotage the Hunt

Fox despises the ritualized slaughter of the helpless.

The pack must never participate in or support a fox hunt or similar sport-hunt targeting prey for cruelty or tradition rather than necessity.

When such a hunt is encountered, the pack must actively interfere, mislead, or sabotage it, provided doing so does not directly aid the Wyrm or cause greater harm.

If the pack knowingly allows such a hunt to proceed unopposed, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Fox may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
